N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 463.6 - Conditions for providing services

State Regulations
(a) Family-planning services and information
relating thereto shall be made available without regard to the recipient's
marital status, age or parenthood. (b) Recipients shall not be subjected, either
directly or indirectly, to coercion or pressure of mind or conscience to avail
themselves of family-planning services, and the refusal or failure of any
recipient to avail himself of such services shall in no way affect his rights
to receive public assistance or care or other services if otherwise eligible to
receive such care or services. (c) Recipients shall be assured of freedom of choice of family-planning method and
there shall be arrangements with varied medical resources so that recipients
may choose in accordance with the dictates of their consciences. (d) A staff member of a local social services
department whose cultural values, conscience or religious conviction prevents
him from participating in the provision of family-planning services shall so
report to the social services official or his designee who in turn shall assign
another appropriate staff member to this function in his place. Notes
